intro: Oreomunnea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Oreomunnea mexicana is often found in rocky or mountainous areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils.
